author: Five Binaries
title: Metadata oracle endpoint in Yoroi
description: Yoroi backend doesn't have the capability for fetching metadata from oracle endpoints.

assessments.note: Proposal appears to be a suitable for the challenge. Any additions to Yoroi wallet application is a welcome. I wonder if the question was asked "what else would you like to see in Yoroi?" if users would submit further use cases.

The proposal addresses a very particular aspect of the challenge - creating tools to improve the developers experience on Cardano. The scope of the challenge is very focused, however the thing it has pinpointed will definitely simplify the works of devs on the ecosystem.
The proposed solution improves the development of new applications on Cardano. It is a specialiced case, but still an important pain point that is adressed. The requested funds are also quite low.

I can see the benefit of an open source Yoroi metadata backend, but I wish the proposers had made a stronger effort to describe the use case  or included the rational in their previous proposal.  More rational as to why this would be better than a native Yoroi solution would also be appreciated.
assessments.reply: There is a misunderstanding, this proposal is to implement it into the Yoroi native backend, not as a standalone solution.

assessments.note: There is a need for wallets to access data from oracle endpoints. Yorai backend is a commonly used software adding this feature will create lot of value to the eco system.
The addition of metadata powered oracle in Yoroi's backend can open up a wide range of applications for developers to build out.
The proposers should be able to deliver, however they are already overbudget of this project from a previous fund. They are only asking for a modest amount.
assessments.reply: To clarify - the project was approved, it was over the fund budget, not over the project budget.

assessments.note: The team seem to have the necessary skillset and motivation to implement the project successfully. The budget is reasonable and would add to the Yoroi wallet functionality.

Considering the background of the proposing team, the fact that it's a relatively small task, the small amount of man hours required to implement it and the small budget required I foresee a very high chance of successfully implementing the deliverable of this proposal and improving the experience of devs working with Yoroi.
Five Binaries are pioneer in the Cardano-space. They have a proved track record and their product bockfrost is already used by many products in the cardano ecosystem.

the proposers gained funding in round 3 but have gone over budget.  they have working relationships with Cardano Foundation and Emurgo. They are involved in the blockfrost Cardano API. However it is difficult to tell how much progress they made with the Catalyst 3 funding. The linked github has not been updated in  2 months. I wonder if the 1200 USD requested is sufficient to fund the proposed deliverables.  I suggest the proposers better highlight the progress made in previous rounds to grow the confidence of CAs. This would enhance their chances of winning additional funding.
assessments.reply: The repository reference is owned by Emurgo, not us, so we could not have update it in any way. Also, we feel we are providing enough of progress reporting for our fund 3 - all the projects are within the timeline, we provide the status reports and also presented progress in the last two town halls. Therefore we would like this review as unjustified.

assessments.note: Five binaries have credible development experience and a proven developers. They will be able to complete the proposal as claimed.
The 5 binaries team are a proven infrastructure company in the Cardano ecosystem.
Project already previously funded thus showing interest. It provides a useful functionality for dev's thus addressing the challenge.

The information provided was sufficient to provide insight into the project and links assisted understanding. Budget is reasonable and would be interested to know what else could upgrade the Yoroi wallet.

Since the total amount of work needed is only estimated to be 10 hrs a detailed roadmap is not necessary, however I would have liked to see a more precise start date. Why is an estimate of 3 months from receiving the funds given for a project that would only take 10hrs? Besides that every aspect of this smaller project is clearly described and easy to follow and understand.
The proposal is about the completion of an already started implementation. The deliverables are stated. Nothing more is needed.
only 1200 USD is requested and the specific deliverables are outlined. It will be relatively easy to judge if the project is successful.  Perhaps they will need more funds in a future round.

The proposal involves adding a feature to your backend. This is likely to a simple step and can be easily monitored. The success can also be measured based on the number of developers using the feature.

solution: We want to implement a Yoroi backend endpoint that will provide the metadata oracles datapoints. This proposal has been over fund3 budget.
experience: We launched the first metadata oracle on Cardano, and we were the first community public oracle pool on Ergo blockchain.
